info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 7 at 10:17PM CDT until April 8 at 10:15AM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
* WHAT...Hydrologic flooding caused by overtopped levee on McKinney Bayou.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest Arkansas, including the following county, east central Miller.
* WHEN...Until 1015 AM CDT Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1015 PM CDT, Emergency management reported overtopping on McKinney Bayou Levee on the McKinney Bayou near the intersection of Highway 196 and Miller County Road 61 caused by flash flooding of the immediate surrounding areas. - This includes the following streams and drainages... McKinney Bayou, Boggy Creek, Maniece Bayou, Beech Creek and Red River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Garland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM CDT TUESDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING
